item.title: Muzu.tv signs a major deal with Warner Music
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Irish Times has details on a deal between Muzu.tv and Warner Music. This follows the Muzu deal with with Universal “The agreement enables the website to broadcast thousands of videos from Warner Music’s roster of acts which include artists such as Lily Allen, Green Day, Red Hot Chilli Peppers and Metallica. The deal means that [...]
item.content:encoded:
Irish Times has details on a deal between Muzu.tv and Warner Music.

This follows the Muzu deal with with Universal

“The agreement enables the website to broadcast thousands of videos from Warner Music’s roster of acts which include artists such as Lily Allen, Green Day, Red Hot Chilli Peppers and Metallica.

The deal means that Muzu has now signed agreements with all the major leading music labels – Warner, Universal, EMI and Sony BMG, giving it a distinct advantage over Google’s popular YouTube site, which recently had to block access to videos from the ‘big four’ due to a dispute over licence fees.

As part of the new deal, Warner Music and Muzu will share revenues generated by advertising through the site and its video player.”

muzu tv
Information provided by CrunchBase

item.content:encoded:
Irish-headquartered music video site Muzu has struck a major video and ads deal with U2â€™s music label Universal – as per report from SiliconRepublic

Muzu TV allows fans to create, watch and share music-video playlists. Users can create video playlists from thousands of videos and embed them on their social- networking sites.
